result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth W Judd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores - may not purchase alcohol.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Kenneth W Judd in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State files amended information in both cases. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Defendant will plead to charge in amended information. State recommends CFTS in 14CF1073 and in 15CF925 the State recommends 18 mos probation.
P-NC to both

finding of guilt

                                    Ct 1 in 15CF925-sent w/held. 18 mos prob

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth W Judd in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. The State asks for $1,500.00 signature bond. 

BTC: $1,500.00 signature bond. Warrant is vacated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Warrant forwarded to RPD for entry.

Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant does not appear. Defense indicates he did expect him to be here. The State asks that BW/BF issue in 14CF1073 and that the arrest warrant in 15CF925 be issued

BTC: BW/BF, AW/BF

Defendant did not have adequate notice of today's date and defense asks that the matter be put out. 

BTc: Adj granted - all warrants are stayed.
